get.description: Retrieves a single customer by their unique identifier. Returns 404 if the customer is not found.

put.description: Updates all details of an existing customer. Requires the customer ID in both the route and the request body. The concurrencyVersion must match to prevent conflicting updates (optimistic concurrency). Returns 409 Conflict if the version doesn't match.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an existing customer identified by its unique identifier. This operation cannot be undone. Returns 204 No Content on success.

get.description: Retrieves all customers matching the specified filter criteria. Supports pagination (page, pageSize), sorting (orderings), and filtering.

post.description: Creates a new customer with the provided details. The customer number is automatically generated. Returns the created customer with a Location header pointing to the new resource.

Searches for customers matching the specified filter criteria provided in the request body. Use this endpoint for complex filter combinations that don't fit in query strings. Supports pagination, sorting, and filtering.

put.description: Updates only the status of an existing customer (e.g., Lead, Active, Retired). This is a partial update operation that modifies only the status field. Valid status values: 1 = Lead, 2 = Active, 3 = Retired.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all scheduled jobs.
Retrieves details for a specific job.
Retrieves execution history for a specific job with optional filters.

delete.description: Purges job run history older than a specified date.

get.description: Retrieves aggregated statistics for a jobâ€™s execution history.
Retrieves all triggers associated with a specific job.

post.description: Triggers a job to run immediately with optional data.
Pauses the execution of a specific job.
Resumes the execution of a paused job.
Interrupts the execution of a currently running job.

get.description: Returns the OpenID Connect discovery document.
Shows the signin page for user selection.
Handles the user selection and generates authorization code.

post.description: Issues tokens for various grant types.

get.description: Returns information about the authenticated user.
Returns debug information about the identity provider configuration.

id.description: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the customer.

firstName.description: Gets or sets the customer's first name.

lastName.description: Gets or sets the customer's last name.

number.description:
Gets or sets the customer number in format CUS-YYYY-NNNNNN (e.g., CUS-2024-100000).
This is a system-generated sequential identifier unique per year.

dateOfBirth.description: Gets or sets the date of birth of the customer (optional).

email.description: Gets or sets the customer's email address.

status.description:
Gets or sets the current status of the customer as an enumeration identifier.
1 = Lead, 2 = Active, 3 = Retired. See CustomerStatus enumeration for valid values.

concurrencyVersion.description:
Gets or sets the concurrency version token (as a string Guid).
Used for optimistic concurrency control to prevent conflicting updates.
Must be provided when updating to ensure the entity hasn't been modified by another operation.

CustomerModel.description:
Data transfer object (DTO) representing a Customer.
Used by the application and presentation layers to expose Aggregate to clients.

status.description:
Gets or sets the new status value for the customer.
Valid values: 1 = Lead, 2 = Active, 3 = Retired. See CustomerStatus enumeration for details.

CustomerUpdateStatusRequestModel.description: Request body for changing customer status.

ProblemError.description: Represents an individual error entry with flexible structure for additional data

errors.description: Collection of additional errors outside the result object

ResultProblemData.description: Data section included within a problem details response

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

ResultProblemDetails.description: A Problem Details response containing result information and contextual data (RFC 7807)

ResultProblemError.description: Represents an individual error entry with a message and optional metadata

isSuccess.description: Indicates whether the operation completed successfully

messages.description: Collection of informational or diagnostic messages from the operation

errors.description: Collection of domain or technical errors encountered during the operation

ResultProblemResult.description: Represents the operation outcome with success status, messages, and errors

Bearer.description: The JWT token in the format: Bearer {token}
